GraphicsLab

Class Normal

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphicsLab.Normal

  • public class Normal
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates the concept of a 3D normal
    Author:
    Anthony Jones and Dan Cornford

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private float x
      the x component of this normal
      private float y
      the y component of this normal
      private float z
      the z component of this normal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Normal(float x, float y, float z)
      Constructs a Normal object from its x, y and z components
      Normal(Vector vec1, Vector vec2, Vector vec3)
      Constructs a normal vector by taking 3 co-planar points (not co-linear): Based on computing two vectors in the plane, then taking the vector cross product between these to compute the normal; to get the sign right the vectors must be passed in anti-clockwise order.
      Normal(Vector vec1, Vector vec2, Vector vec3, Vector vec4)
      Constructs a normal vector by taking 4 co-planar points (not co-linear): Based on computing two vectors in the plane, then taking the vector cross product between these to compute the normal; to get the sign right the vectors must be passed in anti-clockwise order.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getX() 
      float getY() 
      float getZ() 
      private void normalise()
      Normalises this normal, so that the normal is of unit length
      void submit()
      Submits this Normal to OpenGL using an immediate mode call

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Normal

        public Normal(float x,
              float y,
              float z)
        Constructs a Normal object from its x, y and z components
        Parameters:
        x - The Normal's x component
        y - The Normal's y component
        z - The Normal's z component

      • Normal

        public Normal(Vector vec1,
              Vector vec2,
              Vector vec3)
        Constructs a normal vector by taking 3 co-planar points (not co-linear): Based on computing two vectors in the plane, then taking the vector cross product between these to compute the normal; to get the sign right the vectors must be passed in anti-clockwise order.
        Parameters:
        vec1 - - first vector pos
        vec2 - - second vector pos
        vec3 - - third vector pos

      • Normal

        public Normal(Vector vec1,
              Vector vec2,
              Vector vec3,
              Vector vec4)
        Constructs a normal vector by taking 4 co-planar points (not co-linear): Based on computing two vectors in the plane, then taking the vector cross product between these to compute the normal; to get the sign right the vectors must be passed in anti-clockwise order.
        Parameters:
        vec1 - - first vector pos
        vec2 - - second vector pos
        vec3 - - third vector pos
        vec4 - - fourth vector pos

    • Method Detail

        the z value of the normal

      • submit

        public final void submit()
        Submits this Normal to OpenGL using an immediate mode call

      • normalise

        private void normalise()
        Normalises this normal, so that the normal is of unit length
